description: This notification is generated when the pwOperStatus object
for a Pseudo Wire is about to transition from the Up state
into some other operational state.
The Metaswitch implementation only ever generates this
notification for a single cross-connect entry.
Support for this notification is configured using the
dcMplsTeMibPwUpDownNotifEnable object in the
dcMplsTeMibEntityTable.
The Metaswitch implementation never sends this notification as a
result of DC-TPM being deactivated or dcMplsTeMibPwAdminStatus
being set to 'down'.

event.Summary: Operational status of Pseudo wire {$v2} switched to Down

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-PWE3-MIB::pwDown DC-PWE3-MIB::pwType i 0 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwID u 9999 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddrType i 0 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddr s EXAM

description: This value indicates the service to be carried over
this PW.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwType

description: Pseudowire identifier. If defined, the value of the
pwID object MUST be unique among PWs with the same values
for the pwPeerAddr and pwType objects.
Zero means 'not defined'.
If the pwOwner object is 'pwIdFecSignaling', this object
is used in the outgoing PW ID field within the 'Virtual
Circuit FEC Element'.
If the pwOwner object is 'manual', although this object
is not used in signaling, it may need to be set in order
to provide unique reverse mappings for the
pwIndexMappingTable and pwPeerMappingTable.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwID

description: Denotes the address type of the peer node. It SHOULD be
set to 'unknown' if the address is unknown.
The object cannot be set to 'unknown' if pwOwner equals
'genFecSignaling' or 'pwIdFecSignaling'.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddrType

description: This object contains the value of the peer node address.
It contains a value of all zeroes if not applicable
(pwPeerAddrType is 'unknown').
The object cannot be set to all zeroes if pwOwner equals
'genFecSignaling' or 'pwIdFecSignaling'.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddr

description: This notification is generated when the pwOperStatus object
for a Pseudo Wire is about to enter the Up state.
The Metaswitch implementation only ever generates this
notification for a single cross-connect entry.
Support for this notification is configured using the
dcMplsTeMibPwUpDownNotifEnable object in the
dcMplsTeMibEntityTable.

event.Summary: Operational status of Pseudo wire {$v2} switched to Up

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-PWE3-MIB::pwUp DC-PWE3-MIB::pwType i 0 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwID u 9999 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddrType i 0 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddr s EXAM

description: This value indicates the service to be carried over
this PW.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwType

description: Pseudowire identifier. If defined, the value of the
pwID object MUST be unique among PWs with the same values
for the pwPeerAddr and pwType objects.
Zero means 'not defined'.
If the pwOwner object is 'pwIdFecSignaling', this object
is used in the outgoing PW ID field within the 'Virtual
Circuit FEC Element'.
If the pwOwner object is 'manual', although this object
is not used in signaling, it may need to be set in order
to provide unique reverse mappings for the
pwIndexMappingTable and pwPeerMappingTable.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwID

description: Denotes the address type of the peer node. It SHOULD be
set to 'unknown' if the address is unknown.
The object cannot be set to 'unknown' if pwOwner equals
'genFecSignaling' or 'pwIdFecSignaling'.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddrType

description: This object contains the value of the peer node address.
It contains a value of all zeroes if not applicable
(pwPeerAddrType is 'unknown').
The object cannot be set to all zeroes if pwOwner equals
'genFecSignaling' or 'pwIdFecSignaling'.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddr

description: This notification is generated when a MIB-configured
Pseudowire is about to be deleted as a result of the
pwRowStatus being set to destroy(6), or when an auto-created
Pseudowire is about to be deleted because the BGP auto-
discovery process has determined that its route is no longer
required.
In the Metaswitch implementation, support for this notification
is configured using the dcMplsTeMibPwDeletedNotifEnable
object in the dcMplsTeMibEntityTable.
The Metaswitch implementation never sends this notification as a
result of DC-TPM being deactivated or PW Admin Status
being set to down.

Summary.eval: ($v5==1) ? 'Pseudo wire is deleted and auto created' : 'Pseudo wire deleted'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-PWE3-MIB::pwDeleted DC-PWE3-MIB::pwType i 0 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwID u 9999 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddrType i 0 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddr s EXAM DC-PWE3-MIB::pwWasAutoCreated i 1

description: This value indicates the service to be carried over
this PW.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwType

description: Pseudowire identifier. If defined, the value of the
pwID object MUST be unique among PWs with the same values
for the pwPeerAddr and pwType objects.
Zero means 'not defined'.
If the pwOwner object is 'pwIdFecSignaling', this object
is used in the outgoing PW ID field within the 'Virtual
Circuit FEC Element'.
If the pwOwner object is 'manual', although this object
is not used in signaling, it may need to be set in order
to provide unique reverse mappings for the
pwIndexMappingTable and pwPeerMappingTable.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwID

description: Denotes the address type of the peer node. It SHOULD be
set to 'unknown' if the address is unknown.
The object cannot be set to 'unknown' if pwOwner equals
'genFecSignaling' or 'pwIdFecSignaling'.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddrType

description: This object contains the value of the peer node address.
It contains a value of all zeroes if not applicable
(pwPeerAddrType is 'unknown').
The object cannot be set to all zeroes if pwOwner equals
'genFecSignaling' or 'pwIdFecSignaling'.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddr

description: Identifies whether this PW was auto-created through L2VPN Manager as
a result of the auto-discovery process or not (in which case it was
manually configured).
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwWasAutoCreated

description: This notification is generated when a remote LSR tries to
signal a Pseudo Wire, but the Pseudo Wire has not been
configured locally. The operator, on receipt of this
notification, may choose to configure the Pseudo Wire
locally.
Support for this notification is configured using the
dcMplsTeMibUnexpecPwNotifEnable object in the
dcMplsTeMibEntityTable.

event.Summary: Pseudo Wire (type: $v1) is not configured locally. Protocol: $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-PWE3-MIB::pwUnexpectedPwRcvd DC-PWE3-MIB::pwType i 0 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwOwner i 1 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwID u 9999 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddrType i 0 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddr s EXAM DC-PWE3-MIB::pwMplsPeerLdpID s EXAMPL DC-PWE3-MIB::pwRemoteIfMtu u 9999 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwRemoteIfString s EXAMPLE DC-PWE3-MIB::pwRemoteCapabilities b 0 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwRmtFragCapability b 0 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwFcsRetentionStatus b 0 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwGroupAttachmentID s EXAMPLE DC-PWE3-MIB::pwLocalAttachmentID s EXAMPLE DC-PWE3-MIB::pwRemoteAttachmentID s EXAMPLE DC-PWE3-MIB::pwGenAGIType u 0 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwGenLocalAIIType u 0 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwGenRemoteAIIType u 0 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwRemoteCCTypes b 0 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwRemoteCVTypes b 0

description: This value indicates the service to be carried over
this PW.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwType

description: Set by the operator to indicate the protocol responsible
for establishing this PW.
The Metaswitch implementation supports the following 4 values
for this object.
'manual' is used in all cases where no maintenance
protocol (PW signaling) is used to set-up the PW, i.e.
require configuration of entries in the PW tables including
PW labels, etc.
'pwIdFecSignaling' is used in case of signaling with the
Pwid FEC element with LDP signaling.
'genFecSignaling' is used in case of LDP signaling with
the generalized FEC.
'bgp' is used in case of BGP signaling.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwOwner

description: Pseudowire identifier. If defined, the value of the
pwID object MUST be unique among PWs with the same values
for the pwPeerAddr and pwType objects.
Zero means 'not defined'.
If the pwOwner object is 'pwIdFecSignaling', this object
is used in the outgoing PW ID field within the 'Virtual
Circuit FEC Element'.
If the pwOwner object is 'manual', although this object
is not used in signaling, it may need to be set in order
to provide unique reverse mappings for the
pwIndexMappingTable and pwPeerMappingTable.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwID

description: Denotes the address type of the peer node. It SHOULD be
set to 'unknown' if the address is unknown.
The object cannot be set to 'unknown' if pwOwner equals
'genFecSignaling' or 'pwIdFecSignaling'.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddrType

description: This object contains the value of the peer node address.
It contains a value of all zeroes if not applicable
(pwPeerAddrType is 'unknown').
The object cannot be set to all zeroes if pwOwner equals
'genFecSignaling' or 'pwIdFecSignaling'.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddr

description: The peer LDP identifier as identified from the LDP
session. Should return the value of zero if not applicable
or not known yet.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwMplsPeerLdpID

description: The remote interface MTU as (optionally) received from the
remote node via the maintenance protocol. Should be zero
if this parameter is not available or not used.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwRemoteIfMtu

description: Indicates the interface description string as received by
the maintenance protocol. It MUST be a NULL string if not
applicable or not known yet.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwRemoteIfString

description: Indicates the capabilities as advertised by the peer.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwRemoteCapabilities

description: The status of the fragmentation based on the local
configuration and the peer capabilities as advertised by
the peer if control protocol is used.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwRmtFragCapability

description: The status of the FCS retention negotiation process based on
local configuration (in the pwLocalIfParmsTable) and the
remote advertisement.
remoteIndicationUnknown - set if a FEC has not been received
from the remote.
remoteRequestFcsRetention - indicates that the peer has
requested for FCS retention. FCS retention will be used if
the local node is capable and configured to use it for this
PW.
fcsRetentionEnabled - FCS retention is enabled (both peers
were configured for FCS retention for signaled PW, or the
local node is configured and capable for FCS retention for
manually assigned PW).
fcsRetentionDisabled - FCS retention is disabled (not
configured locally nor advertised by the peer).
fcsRetentionFcsSizeMismatch - set if there is an FCS size
mismatch between the local and the peer node.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwFcsRetentionStatus

description: This object is an octet string representing the attachment
group identifier (AGI) that this PW belongs to, which
typically identifies the VPN ID.
Applicable if pwOwner equals 'genFecSignaling' or
'manual'. If pwOwner is 'genFecSignaling' it must be set
to a non-zero value.
The sixtuple (pwGenAGIType, pwGroupAttachmentID
pwGenLocalAIIType, pwLocalAttachmentID, pwRemoteAIIType
pwRemoteAttachmentId) must be unique amongst all PWs in
the pwGenFecIndexMappingTable. The total length of the 3
attachment ID objects must not exceed 249 bytes.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwGroupAttachmentID

description: This object is an octet string representing the local
forwarder attachment individual identifier (AII) to be
used by this PW. It is used as the SAII for outgoing
signaling messages and the TAII in the incoming messages
from the peer.
Applicable if pwOwner equals 'genFecSignaling' or
'manual'. If pwOwner is 'genFecSignaling' it must be set
to a non-zero value.
The sixtuple (pwGenAGIType, pwGroupAttachmentID
pwGenLocalAIIType, pwLocalAttachmentID, pwRemoteAIIType
pwRemoteAttachmentId) must be unique amongst all PWs in
the pwGenFecIndexMappingTable. The total length of the 3
attachment ID objects must not exceed 249 bytes.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwLocalAttachmentID

description: This object is an octet string representing the peer
forwarder attachment individual identifier (AII) to be
used by this PW. It is used as the TAII for outgoing
signaling messages and the SAII in the incoming messages
from the peer.
Applicable if pwOwner equals 'genFecSignaling' or
'manual'. If pwOwner is 'genFecSignaling' it must be set
to a non-zero value.
The sixtuple (pwGenAGIType, pwGroupAttachmentID
pwGenLocalAIIType, pwLocalAttachmentID, pwRemoteAIIType
pwRemoteAttachmentId) must be unique amongst all PWs in
the pwGenFecIndexMappingTable. The total length of the 3
attachment ID objects must not exceed 249 bytes.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwRemoteAttachmentID

description: This variable indicates the AGI type corresponding to the
pwGroupAttachmentId if pwOwner is set to 'genFecSignaling'
or 'manual'. It is ignored otherwise.
The sixtuple (pwGenAGIType, pwGroupAttachmentID
pwGenLocalAIIType, pwLocalAttachmentID, pwRemoteAIIType
pwRemoteAttachmentId) must be unique amongst all PWs in
the pwGenFecIndexMappingTable.
This field cannot be changed whilst the row is active and
admin up.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwGenAGIType

description: This object is the type of the local forwarder attachment
individual identifier (AII) to be used if pwOwner is set
to 'genFecSignaling' or 'manual'. It is ignored
otherwise.
The sixtuple (pwGenAGIType, pwGroupAttachmentID
pwGenLocalAIIType, pwLocalAttachmentID, pwRemoteAIIType
pwRemoteAttachmentId) must be unique amongst all PWs in
the pwGenFecIndexMappingTable.
This field cannot be changed whilst the row is active and
admin up.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwGenLocalAIIType

description: This object is the type of the remote forwarder attachment
individual identifier (AII) to be used if pwOwner is set
to 'genFecSignaling' or 'manual'. It is ignored
otherwise.
The sixtuple (pwGenAGIType, pwGroupAttachmentID
pwGenLocalAIIType, pwLocalAttachmentID, pwRemoteAIIType
pwRemoteAttachmentId) must be unique amongst all PWs in
the pwGenFecIndexMappingTable.
This field cannot be changed whilst the row is active and
admin up.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwGenRemoteAIIType

description: If signaling is used for PW establishment, this object
indicates the Control Channel (CC) types supported by the
peer, as advertised in a VCCV sub-TLV.
If the pwVCCV bit is not set in the pwRemoteCapabilities field
(this means that the peer has not advertised a VCCV sub-TLV)
then this field is returned as zero.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwRemoteCCTypes

description: If signaling is used for PW establishment, this object
indicates the Connectivity Verification (CV) types
supported by the peer, as advertised in a VCCV sub-TLV.
If the pwVCCV bit is not set in the pwRemoteCapabilities field
(this means that the peer has not advertised a VCCV sub-TLV)
then this field is returned as zero.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwRemoteCVTypes

description: This notification is generated when a Pseudowire is about to
be auto-created by an L2VPN Manager as a result of the BGP
auto-discovery process.
In the Metaswitch implementation, support for this
notification is configured using the
dcMplsTeMibPwAutoCrtNotifEnable object in the
dcMplsTeMibEntityTable.

event.Summary: L2VPN Manager auto created a Pseudo wire of type {$v1}

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DC-PWE3-MIB::pwAutoCreated DC-PWE3-MIB::pwType i 0 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddrType i 0 DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddr s EXAM DC-PWE3-MIB::pwSetIndex u 1

description: This value indicates the service to be carried over
this PW.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwType

description: Denotes the address type of the peer node. It SHOULD be
set to 'unknown' if the address is unknown.
The object cannot be set to 'unknown' if pwOwner equals
'genFecSignaling' or 'pwIdFecSignaling'.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddrType

description: This object contains the value of the peer node address.
It contains a value of all zeroes if not applicable
(pwPeerAddrType is 'unknown').
The object cannot be set to all zeroes if pwOwner equals
'genFecSignaling' or 'pwIdFecSignaling'.
This object cannot be modified if pwRowStatus is 'active' and
pwAdminStatus is 'up'.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwPeerAddr

description: The Pseudo Wire set index.
variables.name: DC-PWE3-MIB::pwSetIndex
